title: NHL draft tracker: Islanders select Schaefer at No. 1, Misa goes No. 2, more
content: The draft is Friday and Saturday. Here's a list of every selection, including detailed analysis for the top 32.

title: Sources: Wolves' Reid to sign 5-year, $125M deal
content: Naz Reid intends to sign a five-year, $125 million contract to remain with the Timberwolves, sources told ESPN.

title: Schaefer goes No. 1 to Isles; Misa, Frondell follow
content: The Islanders selected gifted defenseman Matthew Schaefer, 17, with the No. 1 pick in the NHL draft Friday night. Center Michael Misa went second to the Sharks, and the Blackhawks took Swedish forward Anton Frondell third.

title: Panthers keep playoff MVP Bennett on 8-year deal
content: The Panthers signed Conn Smythe winner Sam Bennett to an eight-year extension worth $64 million on Friday night, hours before the start of the NHL draft.

title: Martinez's near no-hitter, Steer's 3 HRs lift Reds
content: Nick Martinez took a no-hit bid into the ninth inning before allowing pinch-hitter Elias D√≠az's double and Spencer Steer hit three home runs, leading the Reds over the Padres 8-1 on Friday night.

title: Bailey to report to Jazz on Saturday, team says
content: Ace Bailey, the No. 5 pick in the NBA draft Wednesday, plans to report to the Utah Jazz as expected Saturday, a team representative told ESPN on Friday.

title: Marte says fan shouted he messaged late mother
content: Diamondbacks second baseman Ketel Marte said a fan in Chicago who brought him to tears during a game against the White Sox this week shouted that he messaged his late mother the previous night.

title: BYU QB Retzlaff denies woman's rape allegations
content: BYU quarterback Jake Retzlaff responded to a woman's allegations that he raped, strangled and bit her in 2023, calling them "ridiculous and bizarre."

title: Flagg: 'Blessing' not being Mavs' centerpiece
content: Cooper Flagg called it a "blessing" to be the rare No. 1 overall pick who isn't the centerpiece of a rebuilding franchise, landing instead on a Dallas Mavericks roster loaded with veterans, including a few future Hall of Famers.

title: üíç Ravens' safety proposes to longtime girlfriend
content: The Baltimore Ravens safety and Reese Damm, his now-fianc√©e, have been dating since high school and announced their engagement via a shared Instagram post.

title: Best power half-seasons ever: Where Cal Raleigh and Aaron Judge rank -- and whether they can keep it up
content: Two AL hitters are crushing long balls at a historic rate. Before their 81st games, we compare their first-half performances to the best ever -- and whether they can keep it going.

title: Power Rankings: A new No. 1 and a top-5 debut
content: The Mets falling as their slump continues and the Astros notching their highest ranking of the season.

title: Early 2026 NBA mock draft: Meet the four contenders for the No. 1 pick
content: There's considerable excitement around next year's draft class thanks to four players vying for the top spot.

title: Wetzel: Please don't expand NCAA basketball tournaments
content: The NCAA will risk an iconic slice of Americana if it expands the NCAA men's and women's tournaments again.

title: The NFL's most team- and player-friendly contracts at six positions: Who makes the list?
content: We picked out deals that favor the team's salary cap (Sam Darnold) and deals that favor the player's bank account (Jaycee Horn) at key positions.

title: What's ahead in 2025 for Notre Dame, UConn and the Pac-2?
content: Could the Irish make another CFP run? Could UConn build on a breakthrough season? We break down what 2025 looks like.

title: State check: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 1 quiz
content: How well do you know your state sports trivia? From D.C. to Alabama, we're putting your knowledge to the test.

title: A weird, wonderful night with Ryans, the Rockies and an unlikely world-record attempt
content: What happens when hundreds of Ryans -- no Bryans allowed! -- descend on Coors Field in the hopes of making history? Delightful chaos.Ôªø

title: Complete draft order of picks for every round
content: When does your favorite team pick in every round of the draft? Here's a pick-by-pick look at all 20 rounds.

title: Kupcho, Maguire shoot best-ball 60, lead Dow
content: Jennifer Kupcho and Leona Maguire shot a 10-under 60 in better-ball play Friday to take the second-round lead in the Dow Championship, the LPGA Tour's only team event.

title: Will the USMNT's star absentees hurt their hopes for the 2026 World Cup?
content: Christian Pulisic, Weston McKennie, Antonee Robinson, Sergi√±o Dest: the U.S. has none of them at the Gold Cup. Is that damaging to their World Cup prep?

title: 5 questions the USMNT must answer in Gold Cup knockouts (and before 2026 World Cup)
content: The USMNT finished the group stage without a loss, and yet no one seems particularly comforted by that.

title: Sources: Brentford reject Man Utd's Mbeumo bid
content: Brentford have rejected an overall package worth ¬£62.5 million ($85.7 million) for Bryan Mbeumo from Manchester United, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: USMNT's Weah rejects Forest deal
content: Nottingham Forest have ended their interest in Tim Weah after the United States striker rejected the club's contract proposal, sources told ESPN.

title: Guardiola: Grealish omission not due to behavior
content: Pep Guardiola has rejected the suggestion that Jack Grealish's omission from the Manchester City squad has anything to do with his off-field behaviour.

title: Sources: Giroud to join Lille as LAFC confirms exit
content: Olivier Giroud will join French club Lille this summer, sources have told ESPN, after LAFC confirmed it had agreed to terminate the French striker's contract.

title: Leicester part ways with boss Van Nistelrooy
content: Leicester City have confirmed manager Ruud van Nistelrooy will leave the club, nine weeks after they were relegated from the Premier League.

title: Liverpool sign goalkeeper Woodman from Preston
content: Liverpool have agreed a deal to sign goalkeeper Freddie Woodman when his contract with Preston North End expires on June 30.

title: Hayes on Lavelle's stellar return: 'Only one Rose'
content: Rose Lavelle scored a goal and added an assist in her first international minutes in nearly seven months Thursday as the United States beat Ireland 4-0 at Dick's Sporting Goods Park in Commerce City, Colorado.

title: Alonso hopes Mbapp√© fit for Juve: 'We need him'
content: Real Madrid coach Xabi Alonso still cannot say whether Kylian Mbapp√© will be available to play in the next round of the Club World Cup after missing all three group games.

title: Wimbledon odds: Sabalenka, Alcaraz favorites to win
content: We're tracking the odds all the way through Wimbledon, where Aryna Sabalenka and Carlos Alcaraz are the betting favorites to win.

title: How to bet tennis Grand Slams: Wagers to make, ones to avoid at Wimbledon
content: Tennis betting analyst Pam Maldonado offers her strategies and tips for wagering on Grand Slam tournaments.

title: No boxing, no love: Which version of Chavez Jr. shows up against Paul?
content: The 39-year-old risks the possibility of further damaging the credibility of the last name made famous by his father, Julio Sr.

title: Chavez? Tyson? Canelo? Inside the process to pick a Jake Paul opponent
content: Jake Paul discusses his team and other matchmakers to explain the challenges of finding the right matchup.

title: Meet the favorites, sleepers and spoilers of NASCAR's first in-season tournament
content: Whether you're a weekly watcher or a casual Cup fan, this guide will get you up to speed on the drivers in the bracket.

title: 'Had no choice but to run to daddy': Iran's sharp jibe at Israel; hits back at Trump too
content: Iranian foreign minister Araghchi urged Donald Trump to retract his "disrespectful" remarks about Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, emphasizing that such rhetoric hinders potential nuclear deal negotiations. Araghchi's statement follows recent tensions, including Israeli strikes on Iranian nuclear sites and retaliatory missile launches.

title: 'He didn‚Äôt let me go': Kolkata law student gangraped after rejecting proposal; accused filmed act
content: A law student in Kolkata was allegedly gang-raped in her college's security room after being lured with the promise of a key union post. Police have arrested three individuals, including a college alumnus and two current students, following the survivor's complaint and medical corroboration.

title: 20 years after split, Uddhav & Raj join hands to oppose 'Hindi imposition' in Maha
content: Uddhav and Raj Thackeray are set to unite for a joint protest march on July 5 against the alleged imposition of Hindi in Maharashtra schools. This marks their first political collaboration in two decades, sparking speculation of a potential reunion for upcoming civic polls.

title: 'Tufano ko ... ': Suryavanshi's Bollywood-inspired post after 5 sixes
content: India's Under-19 team showcased their dominance by defeating England in the first Youth ODI with a six-wicket victory. Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old debutant, stole the show with a rapid 48 off 19 balls. Abhigyan Kundu's anchored innings ensured a comfortable chase, complementing the bowlers' effort in restricting England to 174.

title: US immigration authority to Visa applicants: Effective July 1, 2025, USCIS will no longer send ...
content: USCIS is changing its text message number to 872466 (USAIMM) from July 1, 2025, to help users easily identify official communications. Applicants should save the new number to avoid confusion.

title: Shefali Jariwala no more: Bigg Boss 13 star dies of cardiac arrest; actress was 42
content: In a devastating turn of events, actress Shefali Jariwala, recognized for her participation in Bigg Boss 13, has tragically died at the age of 42. She reportedly suffered a cardiac arrest on June 27th, as confirmed by a hospital receptionist.

title: Mazagon Dock's Lanka deal to give India big foothold in region
content: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Limited is set to acquire a controlling stake in Colombo Dockyard PLC for $53 million, marking its first international acquisition and providing a strategic foothold in the Indian Ocean Region. This move aims to counter China's growing influence in Sri Lanka and establish MDL as a global maritime player.

title: Orphaned in bus crash, 10-year-old asks God, 'what was our fault?'
content: A ten-year-old boy, Parth Soni, lost his parents in a bus accident near Gholtir in Rudraprayag district. The bus, carrying pilgrims, collided with a truck. Four people died, and others are missing. Parth, in shock, questioned Lord Badrinath. Rescue efforts are difficult due to terrain and currents. The bodies of Vishal and Gauri Soni will reach Rajgarh for final rites.

title: OpenAI CEO takes one of the biggest AI U-Turn; says: Current computers are ‚Ä¶
content: Sam Altman has shifted his stance on AI hardware, now believing new devices are essential as AI evolves, contrasting his previous view. He envisions AI systems deeply integrated into users' lives, moving beyond traditional interfaces. This change aligns with Jony Ive's arrival at OpenAI, sparking speculation about a groundbreaking AI device slated for release in late 2026.

title: Passport Seva 2.0: E-Passports to boost travel security; guide to apply online
content: India's passport services have undergone a significant transformation, as acknowledged by External Affairs Minister Dr. S. Jaishankar on Passport Seva Divas. The Passport Seva Programme (PSP) streamlines application processes, extending facilities to Tier 2 and 3 cities through Post Office Passport Seva Kendras. The introduction of e-Passports, embedded with secure microchips, enhances security and expedites border crossings.

title: Disappointed with decision‚Äô: Justin Tucker‚Äôs agent calls suspension unfair
content: Justin Tucker, renowned for his kicking accuracy, faces a 10-game suspension following NFL investigation into misconduct allegations from massage therapists. Despite no criminal charges, the league found policy violations. Tucker's agent, while disappointed, signals acceptance to move forward, as Tucker denies the allegations. His future is now uncertain after a career decline and release from the Ravens.

title: Indus Treaty arbitration court is illegal, says India
content: India has firmly rejected the authority of the Court of Arbitration under the Indus Waters Treaty, deeming it illegal and refusing to acknowledge its jurisdiction over the Kishenganga and Ratle hydropower projects in Jammu and Kashmir. The Ministry of External Affairs stated that India has consistently opposed the court's existence, considering its formation a breach of the treaty.

title: ‚ÄòDifficult country to trade‚Äô: Trump slams Canada over digital tax, halts talks
content: Donald Trump halted trade talks with Canada. This action followed Canada's digital services tax on American tech firms. Trump called it an attack and cited unfair tariffs on US agricultural exports. He accused Canada of copying the European Union's tax policies. The US will soon impose tariffs on Canadian goods. Experts fear a wider economic dispute due to this halt.

title: 2 drown in UP meat processing unit's blood collection tank
content: In a tragic incident in Aligarh, two workers, Imran Ahmed and Asif Ahmed, died after falling into a blood collection tank at a meat processing factory. The incident occurred while they were cleaning the tank late at night, allegedly under pressure from their supervisor.

title: 'Kannappa' Day 1 Collection: Vishnu Manchu's mythological epic open with Rs 9 cr
content: Vishnu Manchu's mythological epic 'Kannappa' hit theaters on June 27, garnering positive reviews and a strong box office debut, earning over Rs 9 crore on its first day. The Telugu version led with a 55.89% occupancy rate. Featuring Prabhas, Akshay Kumar, and Mohanlal, the film narrates Kannappa's transformation from an atheist hunter to a Lord Shiva devotee.

title: ‚ÄòSitaare Zameen Par‚Äô box office: Film mints over Rs 94 crore
content: Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par' has achieved box office success, grossing over Rs 94 crore in its first eight days. Khan's decision to release the film exclusively in cinemas, bypassing OTT platforms, appears to have paid off handsomely. The film's strong performance has surpassed Akshay Kumar's 'Kesari Chapter 2', although it now faces competition from new releases.

title: PM Modi's 5-nation tour begins July 2, to attend Brazil Brics meet
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will embark on a five-nation tour commencing July 2, including first-ever visits to Ghana, Trinidad and Tobago, and Namibia. He will attend the Brics summit in Brazil, discussing global issues and holding bilateral meetings.

title: Tatas suspend 4 after Air India SATS party video sparks outrage
content: Tata Group took swift disciplinary action, suspending four senior officials from Air India SATS and warning others, after a video surfaced showing executives partying shortly after the tragic June 12 Air India flight 171 crash. The celebration, held at the Gurugram office on June 20, sparked public outrage, with over 3.

title: Telangana HC cancels land allotment to international arbitration centre in Hyderabad
content: The Telangana High Court overturned the BRS government's 2021 order, which had allocated 3.7 acres of prime land in Hyderabad to the International Arbitration and Mediation Centre (IAMC) free of charge. The court cited violations of land revenue laws and alienation rules, noting undue haste in the allotment to a private entity.

title: IIT-Madras eyes global top 50 with major expansion plans
content: IIT-Madras is contemplating establishing a medical college to potentially elevate its global ranking and foster interdisciplinary research, according to Director V Kamakoti. The institution is also planning global research centers in Dubai, Malaysia, and Germany, alongside a sustainability campus in Puducherry, to enhance its international presence and address global challenges.

title: 'Iran can never get nukes': US rebukes Pakistan for criticising B-2 strikes
content: Amid escalating Middle East tensions, US Secretary of State Marco Rubio warned Pakistan about Iran's nuclear ambitions during a call with Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif. This followed US military strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities, sparking controversy in Islamabad.

title: Kolkata rape case: 'Forceful penetration, bite marks' - What medical exam revealed
content: A 24-year-old law student was allegedly gang-raped inside South Calcutta Law College by an alumnus and two senior students after she rejected a marriage proposal. The survivor reported a brutal assault, including filming and threats. Police have arrested the three men, triggering political uproar and protests, with the state government and national commission intervening.

title: After suspending Indus pact, India mulls tweaking Ganges water treaty
content: India is considering revising the Ganges Water Sharing Treaty with Bangladesh, set to expire in 2026. New Delhi seeks a new treaty reflecting its current irrigation, port maintenance, and power generation needs.

title: Rubio hails Rwanda-DRC peace deal; credits Trump for claimed truce of India-Pak
content: Marco Rubio praised President Donald Trump's diplomacy. He cited progress in Ukraine, Russia, Pakistan, India, Iran, Israel, and Africa. Rwanda and the Democratic Republic of Congo signed a peace deal in Washington. The agreement aims to end support for rebel groups. It also plans for Rwandan troop withdrawal from Congo. Trump highlighted potential US mineral rights gains.

title: Kolkata shocker: Victim alleges rape was videotaped; what initial probe revealed
content: Kolkata Police reported the arrest of Manujit Mishra, a former Trinamool Congress Chhatra Parishad leader, for allegedly raping a law student within college premises. Mishra, also a temporary staff member and lawyer, is accused of filming the assault and threatening to release it.

title: Born to fly: Shubhanshu Shukla was always a natural in sky; now he‚Äôs a star in orbit
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, the first Indian to board the ISS, displayed exceptional flying talent early in his career at the National Defence Academy. His instructor, Group Captain (retd) Anupam Banerjee, recognized Shukla's natural aptitude and dedication.

title: Ceasefire next week? Trump hopeful on Gaza deal; Israel-Hamas talks in motion
content: President Trump expressed optimism about a potential ceasefire between Israel and Hamas, suggesting a deal could be reached as early as next week. This follows renewed violence after Israel declared a previous truce over, exacerbating the humanitarian crisis in Gaza. Despite resumed aid flow and US funding, concerns persist over aid distribution, with reports of casualties near distribution centers.

title: 'Without question': Trump says will bomb Iran again if it gets into nukes
content: Following US airstrikes on Iranian nuclear facilities, President Trump warned Iran against resuming its uranium enrichment program, threatening further military action. This came after Ayatollah Khamenei's vow to target US bases if attacked again. Trump asserted the strikes inflicted significant damage, while Khamenei downplayed their effectiveness, accusing the US of protecting Israel.

title: Political outcry over RSS' call to review 'secular' and 'socialist in Preamble
content: Opposition parties have strongly criticized RSS general secretary Dattatreya Hosabale's suggestion to review the words 'socialist' and 'secular' in the Constitution's Preamble, labeling it an attack on the Constitution's core values. Congress leader Rahul Gandhi accused the RSS-BJP of wanting to replace the Constitution with 'Manusmriti'.

title: ‚ÄòOperation Narnia‚Äô and 'Red Wedding': How Israel pulled off 'Game of Thrones' on Iran
content: Israel executed strikes against Iran. The operation targeted military leaders and nuclear scientists. It is called 'Red Wedding' and 'Operation Narnia'. US support amplified the effect. Iran's nuclear infrastructure is damaged. Revolutionary Guard leadership is decimated. Israel exposed Iran's weak defenses. A ceasefire is in place. Future talks are uncertain. Iran may accelerate nuclear weaponization. The situation remains tense.

title: IND vs ENG: Suryavanshi wears no. 18 jersey, sparks Kohli comparisons; photo goes viral
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old, has ignited excitement in Indian cricket with a stunning 48 off 19 balls in his U19 debut against England. Donning the iconic No. 18 jersey, famously worn by Virat Kohli, Suryavanshi's fearless batting and explosive strokeplay have drawn comparisons and fueled hopes for a promising future. His innings powered India U19 to a six-wicket victory.

title: ‚ÄòIt will hurt them‚Äô: Why Putin plans to cut defense budget while West arms up?
content: Amidst rising NATO defense budgets and warnings of a potential Russian attack, President Putin announced a reduction in Russia's military spending, currently at 6.3% of GDP, citing inflation concerns. He dismissed NATO's buildup as non-threatening while acknowledging stalled peace talks with Ukraine due to conflicting proposals.

title: IND vs ENG: Cues from Birmingham nets - Uncertainty over Bumrah, Arshdeep vs Gill
content: After their heartbreaking five-wicket loss in Leeds, the Shubman Gill-led Indian team hit the nets ahead of the second Test of the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, starting on July 2 at Edgbaston. TimesofIndia.com brings you all the talking points from India‚Äôs first net session in Birmingham.

title: Leafs trade buzz: Andersson in Toronto‚Äôs sights; Flames may deal veteran D-man
content: Toronto Maple Leafs are eyeing defensive reinforcements. Rasmus Andersson from Calgary Flames emerges as a potential trade target. Leafs aim to bolster their blue line with Andersson's skills. His addition could provide stability and toughness. Calgary might trade Andersson due to team's rebuilding phase. This move could benefit both teams.

title: 'Verify, fact-check, don't believe ...': Sunil Gavaskar slams fake quotes - Watch
content: Sunil Gavaskar has voiced his concern over the proliferation of fake quotes attributed to him on sports websites and social media. He urged fans to verify information and not blindly believe everything they read online, especially from unverified sources. Gavaskar, currently commentating on the India-England Test series, highlighted the issue after fabricated remarks circulated following India's loss at Headingley.

title: Exclusive: Gukesh vs Carlsen not happening in Vegas; why is world champion not playing?
content: World Champion D Gukesh will not be playing in the Las Vegas leg of the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam, citing exhaustion after Norway Chess. Vidit Gujrathi will replace him, donning Gukesh‚Äôs red jacket. The $750,000 event runs July 16‚Äì20 at Wynn Las Vegas. Meanwhile, the India leg in September is cancelled, and Jan Henric Buettner will step down as CEO on July 1.

title: 'Not on students' union list': TMC distances itself from Kolkata gangrape prime accused
content: The Trinamool Congress (TMC) has distanced itself from Manujit Mishra, the prime accused in a college gangrape case, amidst accusations from the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) of his affiliation with the party. The TMC denies any link to the incident, emphasizing that justice should be based on the crime, not political affiliation.

title: US Supreme Court curbs judge power; Trump says 'radical Left tried to overrule President'
content: In a 6-3 decision, the Supreme Court limited federal judges' ability to issue nationwide injunctions, a victory for President Trump who criticized lower courts for blocking his policies. The case involved Trump's attempt to revoke birthright citizenship, though the court didn't rule on its constitutionality.

title: Gurugram Police gears up to put brakes on road stunts
content: This incident followed closely on the heels of another video showing four undergraduates in a luxury car performing stunts in broad daylight on the Dwarka Expressway.¬†

title: Ensure timely completion of hydroelectric power station works at Polavaram: AP-Genco Director Sujay Kumar
content: The works should progress simultaneously with the diaphragm wall and ECRF works of the main project, he says

title: A.P. government committed to achieving energy efficiency, says Minister
content: First Super Energy Conservation Building Code building of A.P. inaugurated in Vizag; power utilities told to achieve target of 20 lakh rooftop solar connections

title: Joint working group meeting of ICG, Assam Rifles held
content: Discussions focused on enhancing interoperability, sharing best practices, and increasing cultural exchanges to deepen institutional synergy

title: Kuppadam sarees: a woven tale of innovation, elegance and tradition
content: Borrowing its name from a complex weaving technique invented by weavers over 150 years ago, Kuppadam saree is a cultural icon in Andhra Pradesh. With its exquisite details, these woven wonder of silk and cotton blend art and heritage on every warp and weft

title: Anti-lock braking system now mandatory for all two-wheelers manufactured after Jan 2026
content: The anti-lock braking system is designed to prevent wheel lock-up during sudden braking, reducing the likelihood of skidding and crashing

title: Man gets death penalty for murdering six members of neighbour‚Äôs family in Vizag
content: Appala Raju killed six members of a family, including three women and two children, over a personal grudge in 2021

title: French museum in Chandannagar reopens with its false ceiling missing as ASI delays restoration ¬†
content: The museum is located in a 1740-built structure called Institut de Chandernagor, popularly known as Dupleix House, where Joseph Francois Dupleix lived as the governor-general when Chandannagar was a¬†French¬†colony.

title: Four private power companies show interest in setting up 2400 MW plant at Pirpainti in Bihar
content: Three units of 800 MW each to be set up at 1200 acres of land at Rs 28,000 cr investment. It will be the largest private sector investment in the power sector in Bihar.

title: Kolkata gang rape case: Medical exam corroborates ‚Äòforceful penetration, assault marks on neck‚Äô
content: There is evidence of forceful penetration, bite marks and nail scratches on her body, an officer said

title: Coal mining in Odisha may turn out catastrophic for elephants, WII study says
content: Angul forest division, which accounts for 20% of India‚Äôs coal reserve, may lose 390 sq km of area used by migrating elephants as foraging ground and corridor¬†

title: Convicted former BJP MLA seeks pardon from Governor, Congress questions ‚Äòpolitical duplicity‚Äô
content: Some BJP leaders had favoured seeking pardon or commutation of ¬†Kanwar Lal Meena‚Äôs sentence to less than two years by the Governor before his disqualification

title: Bombay High Court orders fertility clinic to preserve deceased man‚Äôs sperm in landmark ART Act case
content: In a significant interim order concerning posthumous reproductive rights, the High Court directed a Mumbai-based fertility clinic to preserve the frozen semen of a 21-year-old unmarried man who died of cancer

title: Police thwart woman‚Äôs self-immolation attempt in Mathura; Opposition questions redressal mechanism
content: The incident occurred on June 26, in the evening, over a land dispute, when the father of the victim and the other side were brought to the police station for legal action

title: Operation Sindhu: Fear, flight, and an uncertain future
content: Soon after the most recent conflict in West Asia broke out, the Indian government evacuated more than 1,400 Indian nationals from Iran and more than 1,100 from Israel under Operation Sindhu. Many of them are medical students

title: Adani indictment case: U.S. SEC updates court on efforts to serve legal documents
content: U.S. SEC has to serve the summons to Gautam Adani and his nephew Sagar through proper diplomatic channels, as it has no jurisdiction to summon a foreign national directly; Court asks for update by August 11

title: Pink buses offer safe ride to women in Bihar
content: The special pink bus services in Bihar, run on CNG, are dedicated to women, and the responsibility of operating them has also been given to women, including conductor and nodal officers in each division

title: Defence sector holds promise for start-ups, MSMEs and entrepreneurs, says ex-chief of Confederation of Indian Industry
content: There is a shift in government policy and a fundamental change in the mindset of entrepreneurs too, says R. Nandini,  former chairperson of the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII), Southern Region

title: MPs across party lines in parliamentary panel support forward-looking policy for Bangladesh
content: All MPs displayed understanding of the issues between India and Bangladesh and there was a real desire among the MPs to mend the bilateral ties and take things forward, say sources

title: Palaniswami to begin tour of Tamil Nadu on July 7 as part of poll campaign
content: Between July 7 and 21, he will visit Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam, Thanjavur, Tiruvarur, and Villupuram districts

title: TNCC president calling on Ramadoss fuels speculation of PMK allying with DMK-front
content: Mr. Selvaperunthagai clarifies that it was a courtesy call and claims that he decided to visit Thailapuram as he happened to pass by that route. Sources close to Dr. Ramadoss also swore there was no conversation about politics during the meeting.

title: Vaiko condemns RSS general secretary‚Äôs call for removal ‚Äòsecular‚Äô, ‚Äòsocialist‚Äô from Preamble
content: He calls for democratic and progressive forces across the country to come together and oppose the Hindutva forces‚Äô attempts to subvert the Constitution

title: RSS never accepted Ambedkar‚Äôs Constitution, says Opposition after RSS leader‚Äôs comment on secularism, socialism
content: Rahul Gandhi says the ‚Äòmask‚Äô of the RSS has come off again; CPI (M) says the RSS exposes its long-standing objective of ‚Äòsubverting‚Äô the Constitution

title: CM Siddaramaiah attacks RSS for stand on ‚Äòsecular‚Äô, ‚Äòsocialist‚Äô
content: The Chief Minister said the two words were inserted when the secular values were being attacked, especially by the RSS and its affiliates.

title: Club World Cup group stage takeaways, predicting the winner, more
content: The Club World Cup group stage is complete and the knockouts begin this Saturday. So let's review the good and bad of the tournament so far, and make some picks for who wins it all on July 13.

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window: Liverpool turn to Hato; Arsenal to make moves?
content: The summer transfer window is now open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done? Get the latest every Friday.

title: Digha Rath Yatra kicks off with political war over chariots between TMC and BJP
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee inaugurated the first ‚ÄòRath Yatra‚Äô from the newly constructed Jagannath temple in the coastal town of Digha. LoP Suvendu Adhikari participated in Rath Yatra in three different places in the State

title: Centre announces Adi Karmyogi programme for nationwide capacity building in tribal scheme implementation
content: Officials deliberate and conclude that the real challenge is a lack of motivation in officials and not a lack of schemes or programmes

title: Death of R&AW officer in Dhaka in 1974 linked to Mujib assassination plot, claims book
content: Manash Ghosh‚Äôs Mujib‚Äôs Blunders suggests Phanindra Nath Banerjee‚Äôs death preceded and possibly foreshadowed the 1975 coup

title: Thackeray cousins to jointly oppose mandatory Hindi in schools
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) and MNS to hold rally on July 5 in Mumbai; Sharad Pawar also voices concern over the three-language policy

title: First batch of pilgrims visit Mansarovar, appeal for more yatra slots to be opened
content: First batch included only 36 pilgrims despite maximum strength of 50 due to withdrawals for health reasons; pilgrims have visited Mount Kailash and Mansarovar Lake and will cross back into India on July 1

title: Rule on AC temperature will take time, says Minister
content: I do not think it will happen immediately; capacities will be gradually built for it over time, says Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav

title: Special court grants NIA 10-day remand of two Pahalgam terror accused
content: The NIA produced the duo before the special NIA court, which granted a further 10-day remand, they said.

title: Devotees throng Puri as Rath Yatra begins; 600 hospitalised due to ‚Äòextreme‚Äô heat
content: Several layers of security were put in place in Puri in order to ensure that one of the biggest religious congregations in India passes without any untoward incident

title: Actor shares ‚Äògoosebumps-evoking‚Äô heroics of an all-women flight crew
content: Actor Antony Varghese‚Äôs Instagram post on his experience of flying from Hyderabad to Kochi in an all-women crew Indigo flight, which eventually landed at the Kochi airport after two aborted landing attempts due to bad weather, goes viral

title: Congress attack on Hosabale comments are a diversionary tactic: BJP
content: The RSS general secretary had called for a review of the terms ‚Äòsecular‚Äô, ‚Äòsocialist‚Äô, added to the Constitution during the Emergency; BJP spokesperson says it is Congress that violated Constitution, calls for apology

title: Karnataka Police recommend unified national platform for efficient cybercrime probes
content: This platform would also enable regulators to monitor bank compliance and response times to law enforcement agency requests, says report

title: Protests erupt across Kolkata over gang rape of law student; Opposition flays Mamata government
content: West Bengal Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari shares pictures of Mishra with Trinamool national general secretary Abhishek Banerjee and other leaders; political parties blame the Mamata Banerjee-led Trinamool Congress government for the incident; protests erupt across State

title: Diesel mixed with water stalls 19 official vehicles ahead of CM Mohan Yadav‚Äôs visit
content: Fuel pump in Ratlam sealed; District Collector confirms presence of water content, FIR lodged against management

title: Congress urges Centre to find out the status of Indians stranded in Russia
content: Urging the government to strongly take up their case with Russia, Punjab Congress president Amarinder Singh Raja Warring says 126 Indian citizens from Punjab, Uttar Pradesh, Jammu-Kashmir and Maharashtra were trafficked into the Russian Army to fight war. At least 14 remain missing, he says

title: Yoga ‚Äòguru‚Äô arrested in Chhattisgarh for possessing cannabis
content: A native of Dongargarh town, the 45-year-old told the police that he lived in Goa for over 10 years and taught yoga to Indians and foreigners; his passport has been seized by police

title: Competition heats up for TNEA 2025 as more students score high cut-off score
content: Several thousand students are bunched in cut-off ranges at all levels. Students with a cut-off of 198 this year will find themselves ranked similarly to those with 197 last year. But they will now be competing against 1,035 more candidates

title: India ‚Äòcategorically rejects‚Äô Court of Arbitration‚Äôs ‚Äòsupplemental award‚Äô on Kishenganga, Ratle hydropower projects
content: ‚ÄúIndia‚Äôs position has all along been that the constitution of this so-called arbitral body is in itself a serious breach of¬†Indus Waters Treaty,‚Äù says MEA

title: Murugan Bhakthargal conference held as a political event, says CPI(M) leader
content: The State government has a soft corner for Hindutva forces, says CPI (M) State Secretary  P. Shanmugam.¬†

title: Supreme Court to examine if verdict requiring probe agency to give accused written grounds of arrest will apply retrospectively
content: Bench issues notice on a petition filed by Karnataka, which had sought a clarification if the judgment in the case of Pankaj Bansal versus Union of India would have retrospective effect

title: Assam, Mizoram draft rules to curb illegal immigration
content: Worried by frequent cross-border movements, the Mizoram government plans to confiscate identity cards of Myanmar nationals

title: INDIA bloc leaders in Bihar slam ECI over revision list, calls it a mockery of democracy and Constitution
content: Left leaders allege that such activities are being carried out with the intention of committing electoral fraud at the behest of Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Toll rates hiked on Bengaluru‚Äôs Electronics City flyover, Attibele highway effective July 1
content: The hike, applicable till June 30, 2026, is based on the Wholesale Price Index as on March 31, 2025, according to a public notice by BETPL

title: Licence of food units with fake health cards to be suspended
content: Health department asks officials to hold Statewide checks to confirm authenticity of health cards issued to food handlers

title: Special Intensive Revision of Bihar electoral rolls akin to NRC: CPI(M) to Election Commission
content: There are fears that it may be used to target a certain section of voters leading to their disenfranchisement, says Polit Bureau member Nilotpal Basu

title: Himachal flash floods: Search and rescue operation resumes
content: Five bodies have been recovered from a hydro project site in the Kangra district that was hit by flash floods on Wednesday; search underway for six missing people

title: HC Telangana High Court sets aside 3.70 acres land allotment to IAMC at Raidurg
content: Free allotment of land cannot be justified unless the purpose of allotment is greater and such allotment is to an institution or person who earns no profit, the Bench said¬†

title: Naidu unveils vision to make A.P. a global tourism destination
content: Tourism is the engine of future growth and key to achieving economic transformation, employment generation, and cultural promotion, says CM at a conclave where 82 MoUs worth ‚Çπ10,329 crore were signed to promote the sector

title: Pomp and devotion marks ISKCON‚Äôs Jagannath Rath Yatra in Vijayawada
content: The yatra sees enthusiastic participation from devotees in good numbers,¬†including many from various States in the country and abroad, people decorate streets with rangoli

title: Trump Hopeful For Gaza Ceasefire, Possibly "Next Week"
content: President Donald Trump said on Friday he believes it is possible that a ceasefire in the Gaza conflict will be reached within a week.

title: Live Updates: Jeff Bezos, Lauren Sanchez Exchange Wedding Vows In Star-Studded Venice Party
content: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez tied the knot on Friday at a sumptuous ceremony with the rich and famous on an island in Venice's lagoon, out of the sight and sound of protesters.

title: Passenger Train Derails In Tamil Nadu, No Casualties Reported
content: A mild scare unfolded at Chitteri Railway in Ranipet District of Tamil Nadu after the ArakkonamKatpadi Memu Passenger Train (No. 66057) derailed. There were no injuries or casualties reported in the incident.

title: Trump Must Stop "Disrespectful" Tone Against Khamenei If He Wants Deal: Iran
content: Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi condemned Saturday the "disrespectful and unacceptable" comments from US President Donald Trump, who claimed to have saved Iran's supreme leader Ali Khamenei from an "ugly and ignominious death".

title: Trump Ends Trade Talks With Canada Over Tax On US Tech Firms
content: President Donald Trump said Friday that he is calling off trade negotiations with Canada in retaliation for taxes impacting major US tech firms, adding that Ottawa will learn of their tariff rate within a week.

title: Jeff Bezos And Lauren Sanchez Are Now Married. See First Pic Of Couple
content: Amazon tycoon Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez tied the knot Friday at a sumptuous ceremony with the rich and famous on an island in Venice's lagoon, out of the sight and sound of protesters.

title: Trump Calls Being President A "Very Dangerous Profession"
content: U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday reflected on threats to his life as he celebrated a court ruling that handed his administration sweeping power to pursue his policy agenda.

title: 19-Year-Old Stabbed To Death In Delhi Over Road Rage: Cops
content: A 19-year-old man was brutally stabbed to death in the Rani Garden area in Shahdara district, police said on Saturday.

title: "Killing Field": UN Says New Gaza Aid System Leads To Mass Killings
content: United Nations officials on Friday said a US- and Israeli-backed distribution system in Gaza was leading to mass killings of people seeking aid and urged Israel to let UN humanitarian supplies to the war-stricken territory resume.

title: Man Kills Father Over Front Seat Dispute In Tempo: Delhi Cops
content: A 26-year-old man allegedly shot dead his father in north Delhi's Timarpur area after being denied the front seat in a tempo that the family had hired to shift to their native place in Uttarakhand, police sources said on Friday.

title: Putin Says Russia Plans To Cut Military Spending From Next Year
content: NATO allies on Wednesday agreed to raise their collective spending goal to 5% of gross domestic product in the next 10 years, citing what they called the long-term threat posed by Russia and the need to strengthen civil and military resilience.

title: A Trump Political Dynasty? His Son Eric Says...
content: Donald Trump's second son fueled speculation that his family seeks to establish a multi-generational political dynasty, saying he and other relatives may run for public office.

title: "Saved Him From Ugly, Ignominious Death": Trump On Iran's Khamenei
content: The US president accused the Iranian leader of ingratitude after Khamenei said in a defiant message that reports of damage to its nuclear sites from US bombing were exaggerated, and said Iran had beaten Israel and dealt Washington a "slap."

title: Danish General Says He Is Not Losing Sleep Over US Plans For Greenland
content: The head of Denmark's Arctic command said the prospect of a US takeover of Greenland was not keeping him up at night after talks with a senior US general last week but that more must be done to deter any Russian attack on the Arctic island.

title: India Bans Imports Of Certain Jute, Other Items From Bangladesh Via Land
content: The goods under these curbs include jute products, flax tow and waste, jute and other bast fibres, jute, single flax yarn, single yarn of jute, multiple folded, woven fabrics or flex, and unbleached woven fabrics of jute.

title: July 5 March Against Hindi "Imposition": Sharad Pawar Led NCP Extends Support
content: The Sharad Pawar-led NCP (SP) on Friday said it will support the protest march scheduled for July 5 here against the "imposition" of Hindi in the school curriculum in Maharashtra through the National Education Policy 2020.

title: Trump Claims He Stopped India, Pak War By Threatening To 'Cancel All Deals'
content: Trump again repeated his claim that he stopped the war between India and Pakistan, which he claimed could have turned nuclear, after he told the countries that Washington would not "trade" with Delhi and Islamabad.

title: "Difficult Country": Trump Calls Off Trade Talks With Canada
content: US President Donald Trump said on Friday that he is calling off trade negotiations with Canada immediately, citing its digital services tax and adding that Ottawa will learn of their tariff rate within a week.

title: Our Oceans Are In Trouble: Here's How To Take Action Beyond The Outrage
content: Our oceans are in trouble. Catches from many of the world's fisheries are declining, with some fishing practices destroying enormous areas of the sea bed.

title: Can Ilia Topuria do everything left on his UFC to-do list by 30?
content: Ilia Topuria reveals his future fight plans if he beats Charles Oliveira for the vacant lightweight title . the 28-year-old will look to become a two-weight champion on saturday . topuria said retirement comments from December were heavily influenced by the drastic amount of weight he had to cut to make the featherweight limit .

title: Grading the Celtics' flurry of trades, plus every deal during the NBA draft
content: the trade window kicked off when the Memphis Grizzlies agreed to trade guard Desmond Bane to the Orlando Magic for Kentavious Caldwell-Pope , Cole Anthony . on Sunday, the most highly anticipated offseason trade took place as the Phoenix Suns forward and former MVP Kevin Durant was traded to the Houston Rockets . Jrue Holiday also was traded from the Boston Celtics to the Portland Trail Blazers on Monday for guard Anfernee Simons and two future second-round picks.

title: NBA 2K25 gets finals prediction right, NHL 25 continues to miss
content: NBA 2K25 correctly predicted the Oklahoma City Thunder to take the title over the Indiana Pacers . 2K Games' simulation forecast a more decisive 4-2 victory for OKC . the point difference between the two teams ended up being only two points off the predicted value .

title: College Football 26 confirms new mascots, other presentation details
content: college football 26's lighting system will correctly simulate regional and seasonal time of day . a primetime game against big rivals will trigger an epic runout . more regular matches without the extra context will feature more modest festivities .

title: NBA free agency: Grading the biggest moves, including Naz Reid's new deal
content: the offseason is here, and teams are making moves to fill their rosters for the 2025-26 season . the move comes after a strong season as the backup center for the Western Conference's no. 2 seed . we're grading the moves and examining what each means for the season and beyond .

title: Who could be a WNBA All-Star starter? Predictions, questions, more for 2025
content: fans' votes count for 50%, players count for 25% . top four guards and top six frontcourt players will be the starters . coaches cannot vote for players on their own teams . the two players with the most fan votes will serve as captains and draft players on "WNBA Countdown"

title: Which NBA teams' drafts get an A? What about a C-? We have grades for all 30
content: my team grades for the 2025 draft are the only ones you'll read that aren't concerned with results . no team, not even the Brooklyn Nets, drafts enough players in one year . trades are also considered .

title: Best picks, surprising moves and top trades: Making sense of Round 1
content: the 2025 draft began with the first of three players selected by the Dallas Mavericks . it ended with the LA Clippers drafting center Yanic Konan Niederhauser with pick no. 30 . the Phoenix Suns landing the top-ranked center in Duke's Khaman Maluach .

title: NHL trade grades: Report cards on Coyle, Dobson, Peterka, more
content: the NHL's offseason is off and running, and the trades have been piling up since the Florida Panthers raised the Stanley Cup for a second straight season . in return, the Blue Jackets traded prospect forward Gavin Brindley and a conditional 2027 second-round pick to Colorado . the avs secured a third-line center by signing Brock Nelson to a three-year contract extension worth $7.5 million annually .
